elements.title: Lever House
elements.contents: ... that Lever House (pictured), slated for replacement with a larger building in the 1980s, was protected as a New York City landmark with a one-vote majority?

elements.title: Janis Sanchez-Hucles
elements.contents: ... that psychologist Janis Sanchez-Hucles was only the second person of color to earn a PhD in psychology from the University of North Carolina?

elements.title: Pomme d'Or Hotel
elements.contents: ... that the Pomme d'Or Hotel was used as the Nazi naval headquarters during the occupation of Jersey, and the Union Jack is raised on the hotel balcony every year to celebrate Jersey's liberation?

elements.title: Philip Kreyenbroek
elements.contents: ... that Philip Kreyenbroek taught Iranian studies at the University of Göttingen due to his interest in Yazidi traditions and the fact that about half of the Yazidi diaspora lived in Germany at the time?

elements.title: Lynde Shores Conservation Area
elements.contents: ... that Lynde Shores Conservation Area is an important resting point for shorebirds and waterfowl migrating along Lake Ontario?

elements.title: Buffalo, New York
elements.contents: ... that Buffalo, New York, was a terminus on the Underground Railroad?

elements.title: Tatjana Gamerith
elements.contents: ... that Tatjana Gamerith and her husband, married for 60 years despite an age difference of 20 years, were awarded a prize for their work to combine art and nature?

elements.title: Dragon Man
elements.contents: ... that in June 2021, scientists described "Dragon Man", a member of a new species of archaic human that lived at least 146,000 years ago on the Northeast China Plain?
